bibl.title: Callimachus at Court.
bibl.note: "I will argue that Callimachus was fully aware, in creating his images of the Ptolemies, that it was necessary for them to bridge as well as maintain two cultures and in his court poetry attempted to reflect this reality by embracing not only Greek but also Egyptian paradigms."
STEPHENS Susan A., Callimachus at Court.
M. Annette HARDER, Remco F. REGTUIT and Gerry C. WAKKER (Edd.), Genre in Hellenistic Poetry = Hellenistica Groningana. 3 (Groningen, 1998) pp. 167-185.
